intro: Mentha isophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are narrow and often have a strong minty fragrance, making it useful in culinary and medicinal applications. Mentha isophylla thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
